result.execSummary:
The defendant Tayvion J Boswell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample. Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges including: DNA surcharges to be paid by August 15th, 2022; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all non-mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.
- Restitution and fines set at $0.00.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

- Not to possess any firearms; ammunition or magazines.
- Not to be in any automobile where any firearm is present.
- Complete a Mental Health and Trauma Evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment by the Dept. of Corrections.

- Complete an AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Comply with random drug and alcohol testing by the Dept. of Corrections.

records.addlTxt: Count 2
Associated with Charge #2

Defendant Tayvion J Boswell in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea hearing proceeded. Global resolution placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNTS 1 and 2.  

The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Case proceeded to sentencing hearing. Sentencing proceeded. Court has reviewed character letters and AODA assessment filed. Statements by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1: The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 3 YEARS, consecutive to COUNT 2, credit for 0 DAYS time served. The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 1 YEAR and 6 MONTHS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR and 6 MONTHS. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 2 YEARS.
*Court imposes the mandatory 6 MONTH revocation of drivers license

AS TO COUNT 2: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to COUNT 1, with credit for 7 days served; with Huber privileges for the Day Reporting Center if eligible and for work. Court objects to release on electronic monitoring.
*Court imposes 2 YEAR suspension of drivers license

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Comply with random drug and alcohol testing by the Department of Corrections.
- Complete an AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment. 
- Complete a mental health and trauma evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment by the Department of Corrections.
- Not to possess any firearms, ammunition or magazines. 
- Not to be in any automobile where any firearm is present.

- Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges to be paid by August 15th, 2022; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Court WAIVED all non mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
*Court sets restitution and fines at $0.00.
*Court orders defendant to provide a DNA sample. 

*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
 
Court grants EXPUNGEMENT for COUNT 2 upon successful completion of sentence for count 2.
Court denies EXPUNGEMENT for COUNT 1.

Defendant taken into custody.

Defendant Tayvion J Boswell in court with attorney Jason A Findling via Zoom.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Defense requested a plea and sentencing date. Court ACCEPTS the court transfer of the defendant's other pending felony case, 2022CF913, set before Judge Kies, for a plea and sentencing hearing. Court set the following filing deadlines. Defense has until June 15th, 2022, to file any change of plea forms and any sentencing documents. Case adjourned to Branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Tayvion J Boswell in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Tayvion J Boswell in custody.  Ann R. Lopez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tayvion J Boswell appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/ live/ 4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
